channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Roger Corman, Producer of Low-Budget Horror Films, Dies at 98
item.description: He had hundreds of horror, science fiction and crime films to his credit. He also helped start the careers of Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola and many others.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Attacks Jabaliya in Northern Gaza, Saying Hamas Has Returned
item.description: Hours before stepping up attacks, Israel urged Palestinian civilians to evacuate the area around Jabaliya. It also issued a wider evacuation order for Rafah, in the south, leaving many confused about where to go to find safety

item.title: 79% of parents have drugged their kids to help them sleep
item.description: Millennials and Gen Z parents have resorted to this practice most, using melatonin, Benadryl—even prescriptions—to help their children at bedtime, Sleep Doctor finds.

item.title: Biden Is Doing It All Wrong
item.description: He is focused on firming up his Democratic base even though the election will come down to centrist swing voters in battleground states.

item.title: Yahya Sinwar Helped Start the Gaza War. Now He’s Key to Its Endgame.
item.description: Hamas’s leader in Gaza is considered an architect of the Oct. 7 attacks that prompted Israel to retaliate. As mediators seek a cease-fire, a deal depends on Mr. Sinwar as well as his Israeli foes.

item.title: Weaning off Ozempic slowly instead of quitting abruptly can help prevent patients from regaining weight, study says
item.description: These patients had reached their target weight and reduced their semaglutide dose over nine weeks.

item.title: Understanding My Son, One Game of Catch At a Time
item.description: In long, quiet, rhythmic games of catch, my son and I found a new way to be together.

item.title: Ahead of Olympics, World Anti-Doping Agency Faces a Trust Crisis
item.description: Concerns are growing that the body whose job is keeping sports free of illegal drugs is failing at that mission, leading Congress to question U.S. support.

item.title: Prosecutors seek 40-year sentence for man who broke into Nancy Pelosi's home and attacked her husband with a hammer
item.description: “There is nothing about the history and characteristics of the defendant that warrant leniency,” federal prosecutors wrote in court documents.

item.title: On a Day of Graduations, Berkeley’s Protests Stand Out
item.description: After weeks of tumult over protests, many college administrators prepared themselves for disruptions. But several ceremonies unfolded without major incident.

item.title: The Controversy Over K-pop Band NewJeans
item.description: The firm Hybe has lost hundreds of millions of dollars in market value because of a feud with the creative force behind the band NewJeans.

item.title: South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem is banned from nearly 20% of her own state as fight with Native American tribes heats up
item.description: Two more tribes banished her this week over comments she made earlier this year about tribal leaders benefitting from drug cartels.

item.title: Ahead of Olympics, World Anti-Doping Agency Faces a Trust Crisis
item.description: Concerns are growing that the body whose job is keeping sports free of illegal drugs is failing at that mission, leading Congress to question U.S. support.

item.title: Burkina Faso Accused of Massacring Civilians
item.description: Witnesses and human rights groups claim the West African country’s military killed more than 220 people, including women and children, in February. It was neither a mistake nor a one-off, they say.

item.title: An auction for a private lunch with Marc Benioff raises $1.5 million in his first year replacing Warren Buffett, who netted $19 million for his final auction
item.description: The weeklong eBay auction that raises money for the Glide Foundation in San Francisco wrapped up Friday night.
